post:
Hello LowEndTalk!

Been a while since I've really  been active as I've been cooking up some great things! Today I've unrelieved my new company RhinoRack Networks and have opened it to the public. With the opening I'm offering a very limited time special and once it is gone it is gone (forever!). Below you will find all the information about the offer and about RhinoRack Networks. If you would like to know more please comment or feel free to stop by the site and begin a live chat with us (we don't bite).

Below you will find the core of the discussion as I don't want to bore the community. So without further text meet "Node1 **_BEAST_**"

Guaranteed RAM: 512Mb
Burstable RAM: 768Mb
HDD Space: 30GB
Bandwidth: 200GB
Core Access: 1 Core
Price $7.00/month (Prorata to the 1st of each month) - [Order Now](https://core.rhinorack.net/cart.php?a=add&pid=15)

Extras for **_Node1 Beast_**:
Double HDD - $3.00/month - Limited Time!
cPanel VPS License: $15.00/month
Extra IP’s: $2.00/month

Below you will find some typical questions we got asked.

> Location of this offer?<

The location of Node1 **_Beast_** is in Orlando, Florida at HostDime NOC2. The facility is home to premium and redundant Tier 1 bandwidth providers (Level3, Global Crossing, Tinet, Savvis).

> Can we get a test IP & download?<

You can use "72.29.91.155" as a test IP and as for a download please contact our sales department about this. Below you will find 3 tests run on our network speed.

`[root@server ~]# wget -O /dev/null http://cachefly.cachefly.net/100mb.test
--18:25:52--  http://cachefly.cachefly.net/100mb.test
Resolving cachefly.cachefly.net... 205.234.175.175
Connecting to cachefly.cachefly.net|205.234.175.175|:80... connected.

Saving to: `/dev/null'

100%[=======================================>] 104,857,600 40.7M/s   in 2.5s

18:26:05 (40.7 MB/s) - `/dev/null' saved [104857600/104857600]
18:26:10 (40.9 MB/s) - `/dev/null' saved [104857600/104857600]
`

[Terms of Service (TOS)](http://core.rhinorack.net/knowledgebase.php?action=displayarticle&id=16)
[Acceptable use Policy (AUP)](http://core.rhinorack.net/knowledgebase.php?action=displayarticle&id=17)

Thanks,
Nick
